Create, Read, Update, Delete Package

Submodules

JSON CRUD Actions

crud.jsonCRUD.add_entry_json(table_type, entry)[source]

Add a new entry to a specified table in the JSON data.

Validates the entry and adds it to the specified table in the JSON data if it doesn’t already exist.

Parameters:

  • table_type (str) – The type of table to which the entry should be added, ‘Course’, ‘Student’, or ‘Instructor’

  • entry (object) – An object representing the entry to be added. Entry can be Course, Student, Instructor

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • bool: True if the entry was successfully added, False otherwise.

  • list: A list of messages indicating success or errors encountered.

Return type:

tuple

crud.jsonCRUD.delete_entry_json(table_type, entry)[source]

Delete an existing entry from a specified table in the JSON data.

Finds and removes the entry from the specified table based on the entry’s ID.

Parameters:

  • table_type (str) – The type of table from which the entry should be deleted, ‘Course’, ‘Student’, or ‘Instructor’

  • entry (object) – An object representing the entry to be deleted. Entry can be Course, Student, Instructor

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • bool: True if the entry was successfully deleted, False otherwise.

  • list: A list of messages indicating success or errors encountered.

Return type:

tuple

crud.jsonCRUD.edit_entry_json(table_type, entry)[source]

Edit an existing entry in a specified table in the JSON data.

Validates the entry and updates the existing entry in the specified table.

Parameters:

  • table_type (str) – The type of table in which the entry should be edited, ‘Course’, ‘Student’, or ‘Instructor’

  • entry (object) – An object representing the entry to be edited. Entry can be Course, Student, Instructor

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • bool: True if the entry was successfully edited, False otherwise.

  • list: A list of messages indicating success or errors encountered.

Return type:

tuple

crud.jsonCRUD.load_json()[source]

Load data from a JSON file.

Reads the JSON data from the file specified by file_path and returns it.

Returns:

The data loaded from the JSON file.

Return type:

dict

crud.jsonCRUD.save_data(new_data)[source]

Save data to a JSON file.

Writes the given data to the JSON file specified by file_path.

Parameters:

new_data (dict) – The data to be saved into the JSON file.

Database CRUD Actions

crud.databaseCRUD.add_course(course: Course)[source]

Add a new course to the database.

Parameters:

course (Course) – An instance of the Course class to be added.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • bool: True if the course was successfully added, False otherwise.

  • list: A list of messages indicating success or errors encountered.

Return type:

tuple

crud.databaseCRUD.add_instructor(instructor: Instructor)[source]

Add a new instructor to the database.

Parameters:

instructor (Instructor) – An instance of the Instructor class to be added.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • bool: True if the instructor was successfully added, False otherwise.

  • list: A list of messages indicating success or errors encountered.

Return type:

tuple

crud.databaseCRUD.add_student(student: Student)[source]

Returns:

  • list: A list of messages indicating success or errors encountered.

Return type:

tuple

crud.databaseCRUD.assign_instructor(instructor: Instructor, course: Course)[source]

Assigns an instructor to a course in the database. Changes the intructor_id field of the course

Parameters:

  • instructor (Instructor) – An instance of the Instructor class.

  • course (Course) – An instance of the Course class.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • bool: True if the instructor was successfully assigned, False otherwise.

  • list: A list of messages indicating success or errors encountered.

Return type:

tuple

crud.databaseCRUD.connect_db()[source]

Establish a connection to the SQLite database.

Returns:

A connection object to interact with the database.

Return type:

sqlite3.Connection

crud.databaseCRUD.fetch_courses()[source]

Retrieve all courses from the database, including their enrolled students as a string e.g(Name1,Name2,Name3)

Returns:

A list of tuples representing the courses and their enrolled students.

Each tuple contains (course_id, course_name, instructor_id, enrolled_students) Returns an empty list if an error occurs.

Return type:

list

crud.databaseCRUD.fetch_instructors()[source]

Retrieve all instructors from the database, including their assigned courses as a string e.g(Course1,Course2,Course3)

Returns:

A list of tuples representing the intructors and their assigned courses.

Each tuple contains (instructor_id, name, age, email, assigned_courses). Returns an empty list if an error occurs.

Return type:

list

crud.databaseCRUD.fetch_students()[source]

Retrieve all students from the database, including their registered courses as a string e.g(Course1,Course2,Course3)

Returns:

A list of tuples representing the students and their registered courses.

Each tuple contains (student_id, name, age, email, registered_courses). Returns an empty list if an error occurs.

Return type:

list

crud.databaseCRUD.register_course(student: Student, course: Course)[source]

Register a student to a course in the database.

Parameters:

  • student (Student) – An instance of the Student class.

  • course (Course) – An instance of the Course class.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • bool: True if the student was successfully registered, False otherwise.

  • list: A list of messages indicating success or errors encountered.

Return type:

tuple

crud.databaseCRUD.unassign_instructor(instructor: Instructor, course: Course)[source]

Unassigns an instructor to a course in the database. Changes the intructor_id field of the course

Parameters:

  • instructor (Instructor) – An instance of the Instructor class.

  • course (Course) – An instance of the Course class.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • bool: True if the instructor was successfully unassigned, False otherwise.

  • list: A list of messages indicating success or errors encountered.

Return type:

tuple

crud.databaseCRUD.unregister_course(student: Student, course: Course)[source]

Parameters:

  • student (Student) – An instance of the Student class.

  • course (Course) – An instance of the Course class.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • bool: True if the student was successfully unregistered, False otherwise.

  • list: A list of messages indicating success or errors encountered.

Return type:

tuple
